abstract: For some time, there has been anecdotal evidence that troops who had severe nerve, muscle or bone damage to an arm or leg were better off undergoing amputations rather than trying to keep the limb. Now there is hard data that seems to confirm that suspicion.

headline.main: Study Finds Amputating Damaged Limbs Improves Quality of Life
